content.title: Foreword
content.description:
This Technical Specification has been produced by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP).
The contents of the present document are subject to continuing work within the TSG and may change following formal TSG approval. Should the TSG modify the contents of the present document, it will be re-released by the TSG with an identifying change of release date and an increase in version number as follows:
Version x.y.z
where:
x	the first digit:
1	presented to TSG for information;
2	presented to TSG for approval;
3	or greater indicates TSG approved document under change control.
y	the second digit is incremented for all changes of substance, i.e. technical enhancements, corrections, updates, etc.
z	the third digit is incremented when editorial only changes have been incorporated in the document.

content.title: 1	Scope
content.description: The present document is an introduction to the 3GPP TS 38.41x series of technical specifications that define the NG interface for the interconnection of an NG-RAN node to the 5GC (5G Core Network).

content.title: 2	References
content.description:
The following documents contain provisions which, through reference in this text, constitute provisions of the present document.
-	References are either specific (identified by date of publication, edition number, version number, etc.) or non-specific.
-	For a specific reference, subsequent revisions do not apply.
-	For a non-specific reference, the latest version applies. In the case of a reference to a 3GPP document (including a GSM document), a non-specific reference implicitly refers to the latest version of that document in the same Release as the present document.
[1]	3GPP TR 21.905: "Vocabulary for 3GPP Specifications".
[2]	3GPP TS 38.411: "NG-RAN; NG layer 1".
[3]	3GPP TS 38.412: "NG-RAN; NG signalling transport".
[4]	3GPP TS 38.413: "NG-RAN; NG Application Protocol (NGAP) ".
[5]	3GPP TS 38.414: "NG-RAN; NG data transport".
[6]	3GPP TS 23.502: "Procedures for the 5G system".
[7]	3GPP TS 38.300: "NR; Overall Description; Stage 2".
[8]	3GPP TS 23.501: "System Architecture for the 5G system".
[9]	3GPP TS 38.415: "PDU Session User Plane Protocol".
[10]	3GPP TS 38.455: "NR Positioning Protocol A (NRPPa)".
[11]	3GPP TS 36.300: "E-UTRAN); Overall description; Stage 2".
[12]	3GPP TS 23.247: “Architectural enhancements for 5G multicast-broadcast services; Stage 2”.

subsections.title: 3.1	Definitions
subsections.text_content:
For the purposes of the present document, the terms and definitions given in TR 21.905 [1] and the following apply. 
A term defined in the present document takes precedence over the definition of the same term, if any, in TR 21.905 [1].
gNB: as defined in TS 38.300 [7].
NB-IoT: as defined in TS36.300 [11].
ng-eNB: as defined in TS 38.300 [7].
NG-RAN node: as defined in TS 38.300 [7].
UPF: as defined in TS 23.501 [8].

subsections.title: 3.2	Abbreviations
subsections.text_content:
For the purposes of the present document, the terms and definitions given in TR 21.905 [1] and the following apply. 
A term defined in the present document takes precedence over the definition of the same term, if any, in TR 21.905 [1].
5GC	5G Core Network
AMF	Access and Mobility Management Function
CIoT	Cellular IoT
DRX	Discontinuous Reception
MBS	Multicast/Broadcast Service
NB-IoT	Narrow Band Internet of Things
NG-U	NG User plane interface
PTP	Point to Point
PTM	Point to Multipoint
QMC	QoE Measurement Collection
QoE	Quality of Experience
RIM	Remote Interference Management
SMF	Session Management Function
UP	User Plane
UPF	User Plane Function

subsections.title: 4.1	NG Architecture
subsections.text_content:
The NG-RAN is layered into a Radio Network Layer (RNL) and a Transport Network Layer (TNL). The NG-RAN architecture, i.e. the NG-RAN logical nodes and interfaces between them, are defined as part of the RNL.
The NG-RAN architecture consists of a set of gNBs and ng-eNBs which are connected to the 5GC through the NG interface and is specified in TS 38.300 [7].
The NG-RAN may have several NG access points towards the 5GC. As a minimum, each NG access point 
(in NG-RAN or 5GC) shall independently fulfil the requirements of the relevant NG specifications (3GPP 38.41x series - see clause 7).
NG is a logical interface.
There may be multiple NG-C logical interfaces towards the 5GC from any one NG-RAN node. The selection of the NG-C interface is then determined by the NAS Node Selection function as described in clause 5.
There may be multiple NG-U logical interfaces towards the 5GC from any one NG-RAN node. The selection of the NG-U interface is done within the 5GC and signalled to the NG-RAN node by the AMF.

subsections.title: 4.2	NG interface general principles
4.3	NG interface specification objectives
4.4	NG interface capabilities
5.1	General
subsections.text_content: The following clauses describe the functions supported over the NG interface.

subsections.title: 5.2	Paging function
subsections.text_content:
The paging function supports the sending of paging requests to the NG-RAN nodes involved in the paging area e.g. the NG-RAN nodes of the TA(s) the UE is registered.
The function also supports CN controlled subgrouping paging for UE Power Saving.

subsections.title: 5.3	UE Context Management function
subsections.text_content:
The UE Context management function allows the AMF to establish, modify or release a UE Context in the AMF and the NG-RAN node e.g. to support user individual signalling on NG.
The function also enables the AMF to manage RRC state notifications of a CM-CONNECTED UE.

subsections.title: 5.4	Mobility Management function
subsections.text_content: The mobility function for UEs in CM-CONNECTED includes the intra-system handover function to support mobility within NG-RAN and inter-system handover function to support mobility from/to EPS system. It comprises the preparation, execution and completion of handover via the NG interface.

subsections.title: 5.5	PDU Session Management function
subsections.text_content:
The PDU Session function is responsible for establishing, modifying and releasing the involved PDU sessions NG-RAN resources for user data transport once a UE context is available in the NG-RAN node.
NGAP supports transparent relaying of PDU Session related information by the AMF as described in TS 23.502 [6].

subsections.title: 5.6	NAS Transport function
subsections.text_content: The NAS Signalling Transport function provides means to transport or reroute a NAS message (e.g. for NAS mobility management), or report the non-delivery of a NAS message for a specific UE over the NG interface.

subsections.title: 5.7	NAS Node Selection function
subsections.text_content:
The interconnection of NG-RAN nodes to multiple AMFs is supported in the 5GS architecture.
Therefore, a NAS node selection function is located in the NG-RAN node to determine the AMF association of the UE, based on the UE's temporary identifier, which was assigned to the UE by the AMF. When the UE's temporary identifier has not been yet assigned or is no longer valid the NG-RAN node may instead take into account other information (e.g. slicing information, onboarding indication) to determine the AMF. When the NG-RAN node is configured to ensure that the selected AMF serves the country where the UE is located, as described in TS 23.501 [8], the NG-RAN node takes into account UE location information, if available, when determining the AMF.
This functionality is located in the NG-RAN node and enables proper routing via the NG interface. On NG, no specific procedure corresponds to the NAS Node Selection Function.

subsections.title: 5.8	NG Interface Management function
5.9	Warning Message Transmission function
subsections.text_content: The warning message transmission function provides means to transfer warning messages via NG interface or cancel ongoing broadcast of warning messages. It also provides the capability for the NG-RAN to inform the AMF that ongoing PWS operation has failed for one or more areas, or that one or more areas may be reloaded by the CBC.

subsections.title: 5.10	Configuration Transfer function
subsections.text_content: The Configuration Transfer function is a generic mechanism that allows the request and transfer of RAN configuration information (e.g. SON information) between two RAN nodes via the core network.

subsections.title: 5.11	Trace function
subsections.text_content: The Trace function provides means to control trace sessions in the NG-RAN node.

subsections.title: 5.12	AMF Management function
subsections.text_content: The AMF management function supports AMF planned removal and AMF auto-recovery as specified in TS 23.501 [8].

subsections.title: 5.13	Multiple TNL Associations Support Function
subsections.text_content: When there are multiple TNL associations between a NG-RAN node and an AMF, the NG-RAN node selects the TNL association for NGAP signalling based on the usage and the weight factor of each TNL association received from the AMF, and uses the TNL association as specified in TS 23.501 [8] and TS 23.502 [6]. If an AMF releases a TNL association or a TNL association has failed, the NG-RAN node selects a new one as specified in TS 23.501 [8] and TS 23.502 [6].

subsections.title: 5.14	AMF Load Balancing function
subsections.text_content: The NG interface supports the indication by the AMF of its relative capacity to the NG-RAN node in order to achieve load-balanced AMFs within the pool area.

subsections.title: 5.15	Location Reporting function
subsections.text_content: This function enables the AMF to request the NG-RAN node to report the UE's current location, or the UE's last known location with timestamp, or the UE's presence in a configured area of interest.

subsections.title: 5.16	AMF Re-allocation function
subsections.text_content: This function allows to redirect an initial connection request issued by an NG-RAN node from an initial AMF towards a target AMF selected by 5GC. In this case the NG-RAN node initiates an Initial UE Message procedure over one NG interface instance and receives the first downlink message to close the UE-associated logical connection over a different NG interface instance.

subsections.title: 5.17	UE Radio Capability Management function
subsections.text_content: The UE Radio Capability Management function is related to the UE radio capability handling.

subsections.title: 5.18	NRPPa Signaling Transport function
subsections.text_content: The NRPPa (NR Positioning Protocol A) Signalling Transport function provides means to transport an NRPPa (3GPP TS 38.455 [10]) message transparently over the NG interface.

subsections.title: 5.19	Overload Control function
subsections.text_content: The overload function provides means to enable AMF controls the load that the NG-RAN node(s) are generating.

subsections.title: 5.20	Report of Secondary RAT data volumes Function
subsections.text_content: The Report of Secondary RAT data volumes Function enables the NG-RAN node to report Secondary RAT usage data information in case of MR-DC, either with a dedicated procedure or by including Secondary RAT usage data information in other messages.

subsections.title: 5.21	RIM Information Transfer function
subsections.text_content: The RIM Information Transfer function is a generic mechanism that allows the transfer of Remote Interference Management (RIM) information between two RAN nodes via the core network.

subsections.title: 5.22	Retrieve UE Information function
subsections.text_content: The Retrieve UE Information function enables the NG-RAN node to request UE information (e.g. QoS differentiation information) from the AMF before the setup of the NG connection for NB-IoT UE(s) using Control Plane CIoT 5GS Optimization.

subsections.title: 5.23	RAN CP Relocation Indication function
subsections.text_content: The RAN CP Relocation Indication function enables the initiation of the UE-associated logical NG-connection for a NB-IoT UE using Control Plane CIoT 5GS Optimisation following a re-establishment request. It allows to have the re-estabblishment request authenticated by the AMF.

subsections.title: 5.24	Suspend-Resume function
subsections.text_content: This function enables to suspend the UE-associated logical NG-connection and release the NG-U tunnel while storing the UE context in the NG-RAN for a faster subsequent resume as specified for User Plane CIoT 5GS optimizations in TS 23.501 [8]. In this version of the specification, this function only applies for long eDRX cycles.

subsections.title: 5.25	Connection Establishment Indication Function
subsections.text_content: The connection establishment indication function enables the AMF to complete the establishment of the UE-associated logical NG-connection.

subsections.title: 5.26	AMF CP Relocation Indication Function
subsections.text_content: The AMF CP relocation indication function enables the AMF to inform the previously serving NG-RAN node that the UE's connection is to be relocated to a new NG-RAN node.

subsections.title: 5.27	NR MBS Session Management function
subsections.text_content:
The MBS Session Management function is responsible for establishing, modifying and releasing the involved NR MBS sessions NG-RAN resources for user data transport once an MBS context is available in the NG-RAN node.
NGAP supports transparent relaying of MBS Session related information by the AMF as described in TS 23.247 [12].

subsections.title: 5.28	Multicast Group Paging Function
subsections.text_content: The Multicast group paging function supports the sending of multicast group paging requests to the NG-RAN nodes in order to group-page UEs that have joined the Multicast MBS Session

subsections.title: 5.29	QMC support function
subsections.text_content: The QMC function provides means to manage the QMC sessions and support the mobility of QMC sessions over the NG interface.

subsections.title: 5.30	MT Communication Handling function
subsections.text_content: The function enables to support MT data and signalling handling within the CN for UEs in RRC_INACTIVE state with extended DRX beyond 10.24s as specified in TS 23.501[8].

subsections.title: 5.31	Timing Synchronisation Status Reporting function
subsections.text_content: The Timing Synchronisation Status Reporting function enables the AMF to request the NG-RAN node to report the RAN timing synchronisation status information, and for the NG-RAN node to provide the RAN timing synchronisation status information to the AMF.

content.title: 6	Signalling procedures of the NG interface

subsections.title: 6.1	PDU Session Management Procedures
6.2	UE Context Management Procedures
6.3	NAS transport procedures
6.4	UE Mobility Management Procedures
6.5	Paging procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following paging procedure is used to send paging requests to the NG-RAN nodes involved in the paging area:
-	Paging.

subsections.title: 6.6	AMF Management procedures
6.7	NG Interface Management procedures
6.8	Warning message transmission procedures
6.9	Location Reporting procedures
6.10	UE Radio Capability Management procedures
6.11	UE Tracing procedures
6.12	NR Positioning Protocol A (NRPPa) procedures
6.13	Overload Control procedures
6.14	Configuration Transfer procedures
6.15	Secondary RAT Data Usage Report procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is used to provide information on the used resources of the secondary RAT:
-	Secondary RAT Data Usage Report procedure.

subsections.title: 6.16	RIM Information Transfer procedures
6.17	Retrieve UE Information procedures
6.18	RAN CP Relocation Indication procedures
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is used by the NG-RAN node to initiate the UE-associated logical NG-connection for the RAN CP Relocation function:
-	RAN CP Relocation Indication procedure.

subsections.title: 6.19	UE Context Suspend procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is to suspend the UE-associated logical NG-connection and release the NG-U tunnel with the 5GC while keeping the UE context in NG-RAN. In this version of the specification, this procedure applies only if the NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB.
-	UE Context Suspend procedure.

subsections.title: 6.20	Connection Establishment Indication procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is used to enable the AMF to provide information to the NG-RAN node to complete the establishment of the UE-associated logical NG-connection, for UEs using CIoT 5GS Optimization:
-	Connection Establishment Indication.
The UE Radio Capability may be provided from the AMF to the NG-RAN node in this procedure. If the UE Radio Capability is not included, this may trigger the NG-RAN node to request the UE Radio Capability from the UE and to provide it to the AMF in the UE RADIO CAPABILITY INFO INDICATION message.

subsections.title: 6.21	AMF CP Relocation Indication procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is used to inform the previously serving NG-RAN node that the UE's connection is to be relocated to a new NG-RAN node, for UEs using Control Plane CIoT 5GS optimizations:
-	AMF CP Relocation Indication.

subsections.title: 6.22	UE Context Resume procedure
subsections.text_content:
The following procedure is used to resume the UE context, resume the suspended logical NG-connection and re-establish the related NG-U tunnel in the 5GC for the involved UE. In this version of the specification, this procedure applies only if the NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB.
-	UE Context Resume procedure.

subsections.title: 6.23	NR MBS Session Management Procedures
6.24	Multicast Group Paging Procedures
subsections.text_content:
The following Multicast Group Paging procedure is used to send multicast group paging requests to the NG-RAN nodes:
-	Multicast Group Paging.

subsections.title: 6.25	The procedures for supporting QMC
6.26	MT Communication Handling procedures
subsections.text_content:
The following procedures are used by the NG-RAN node to request the AMF to activate or deactivate the CN based MT communication handling for UEs in RRC_INACTIVE state with long extended DRX beyond 10.24 seconds, and by the CN to indicate availability of downlink data or downlink signalling to the NG-RAN node.
-	MT Communication Handling procedure.
-	RAN Paging Request procedure.

subsections.title: 6.27	Timing Synchronisation Status Reporting procedures
7.1	NG Control Plane
subsections.text_content:
The control plane protocol stack of the NG interface is shown on Figure 7.1-1. The transport network layer is built on IP transport. For the reliable transport of signalling messages, SCTP is added on top of IP. The application layer signalling protocol is referred to as NGAP (NG Application Protocol).
The figure depicts the interface control plane of a 5G network, showing the various components and their connections. The diagram illustrates the control plane's role in managing network functions, such as network slicing, network slicing, and network slicing.
Figure 7.1-1: NG Interface Control Plane

subsections.title: 7.2	NG User Plane
subsections.text_content:
The NG user plane (NG-U) interface is defined between a NG-RAN node and a UPF. The NG-U interface provides non guaranteed delivery of PDU Session/MBS session user plane PDUs between the NG-RAN node and the UPF.
The protocol stack for NG-U is shown in Figure 7.2-1.
The NG-U protocol structure for PDU /MBS Session in Figure 7.2-1 illustrates the communication between a PDU (Primary User Device) and a MBS (Multiplexed Base Station) in a 5G network. The diagram highlights the key components, including the PDU, MBS, and the network infrastructure, which are essential for efficient communication.
Figure 7.2-1: NG-U protocol structure for PDU/MBS Session

subsections.title: 8.1	NG-RAN NG interface: NG layer 1 (TS 38.411)
subsections.text_content: TS 38.411 [2] specifies the physical layer technologies that may be used to support the NG interface.

subsections.title: 8.2	NG-RAN NG interface:  NG signalling transport (TS 38.412)
subsections.text_content: TS 38.412 [3] specifies how the NGAP signalling messages are transported over NG.

subsections.title: 8.3	NG-RAN NG interface: NG application protocol (NGAP) (TS 38.413)
subsections.text_content: TS 38.413 [4] specifies the radio network layer signalling procedures of the control plane between the NG-RAN node and the AMF.

subsections.title: 8.4	NG-RAN NG interface: NG data transport (TS 38.414)
subsections.text_content: TS 38.414 [5] specifies the standards for user data transport protocols over the NG interface.

subsections.title: 8.5	NG-RAN NG interface: NG PDU Session user plane protocol (TS 38.415)
subsections.text_content: TS 38.415 [9] specifies the PDU Session user plane protocol procedures, and the PDU Set Information user plane protocol procedures over the NG interface.
